info.title: Altzone API
info.description:
This is a description of API for the Altzone game.
This swagger document is describing endpoint in more details and includes the request objects structure, examples, authorization rules and any other additional information.
Notice,  that it does not include common rules and functions, since they are covered on the wikipages in GitHub

servers.description: Production. Stable version of API, which might not have all of the new changes
Development. Current version of API with latest changes

get.description:
Read all created Clans. Remember about the pagination

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | no |
| Authorization   | no |
| Search | yes | 
| Sort | yes |
| Pagination | yes |

put.description:
Update the Clan, which _id is specified in the body. 

Only Clan admins can change the Clan's data, as well as add or remove admins. Notice that while removing Clan admins, its is not allowed to remove all of them, because Clan must have at least one admin.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | only for Clan admins | 


The **labels** enum values:

|                         |                            |                      |                       |
|-------------------------|----------------------------|----------------------|-----------------------|
| 'eläinrakkaat'          | 'maahanmuuttomyönteiset'   | 'lgbtq+'             | 'raittiit'            |
| 'kohteliaat'            | 'kiusaamisenvastaiset'     | 'urheilevat'         | 'syvälliset'          |
| 'oikeudenmukaiset'      | 'kaikkien kaverit'         | 'itsenäiset'         | 'retkeilijät'         |
| 'suomenruotsalaiset'    | 'huumorintajuiset'         | 'rikkaat'            | 'ikiteinit'           |
| 'juoruilevat'           | 'rakastavat'               | 'oleilijat'          | 'nörtit'              |
| 'musadiggarit'          | 'tunteelliset'             | 'gamerit'            | 'animefanit'          |
| 'sinkut'                | 'monikulttuuriset'         | 'kauniit'            | 'järjestelmälliset'   |
| 'epäjärjestelmälliset'  | 'tasa-arvoiset'            | 'somepersoonat'      | 'kädentaitajat'       |
| 'muusikot'              | 'taiteilijat'              | 'spämmääjät'         | 'kasvissyöjät'        |
| 'tasapainoiset'         |                            |                      |                       |

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

post.description:
Create a new Clan. The creator of the Clan becomes its admin. Notice that if Player is creating a new Clan, he/she becomes a member of it, that means that if Player is member of some Clan it can not create a new one, before leaving the old one.

Also endpoint creates Clan's Stock, as well as Clan's SoulHome and Rooms. For the created Clan a set of default Items will be added to Stock and to one of the SoulHome Rooms.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | Player can be in one Clan only at one time => if Player already is in another Clan, he/she can not create a new one | 

The **labels** enum values:

|                         |                            |                      |                       |
|-------------------------|----------------------------|----------------------|-----------------------|
| 'eläinrakkaat'          | 'maahanmuuttomyönteiset'   | 'lgbtq+'             | 'raittiit'            |
| 'kohteliaat'            | 'kiusaamisenvastaiset'     | 'urheilevat'         | 'syvälliset'          |
| 'oikeudenmukaiset'      | 'kaikkien kaverit'         | 'itsenäiset'         | 'retkeilijät'         |
| 'suomenruotsalaiset'    | 'huumorintajuiset'         | 'rikkaat'            | 'ikiteinit'           |
| 'juoruilevat'           | 'rakastavat'               | 'oleilijat'          | 'nörtit'              |
| 'musadiggarit'          | 'tunteelliset'             | 'gamerit'            | 'animefanit'          |
| 'sinkut'                | 'monikulttuuriset'         | 'kauniit'            | 'järjestelmälliset'   |
| 'epäjärjestelmälliset'  | 'tasa-arvoiset'            | 'somepersoonat'      | 'kädentaitajat'       |
| 'muusikot'              | 'taiteilijat'              | 'spämmääjät'         | 'kasvissyöjät'        |
| 'tasapainoiset'         |                            |                      |                       |

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

get.description:
Read logged-in user Profile data

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | only own |
| Search | no | 
| Sort | no |
| Pagination | no |

put.description: Update logged-in user Profile data. Notice that only fields needed to be updated should be specified.

post.description: Create a user profile with Player object associated with it. Notice, that it is also possible in some edge cases to create a Profile without Player object assosiated with it, however it is not recommended and API expects that for every Profile there is a Player object created.

delete.description: Delete logged-in user's Profile. Notice, that Profile deletion will lead removing all user data, such as Player and CustomCharacters. Since the Player object is assosiated with the Clan, user will be also removed from the Clan. Notice, that if there was nobody in the Clan the Clan with all assosiated objects will be removed. However, in case if the user was admin in this Clan and there are no other admins the user must first set at least one admin for this Clan, overwise the Profile will not be removed and 403 will be returned.

get.description:
Read all created Players. Remember about the pagination

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | no |
| Search | yes | 
| Sort | yes |
| Pagination | yes |

put.description:
Update the Player, which _id is specified in the body. Only Player, which belong to the logged-in Profile can be changed.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has | 
| -------- | -------- | 
| Authentication | yes | 
| Authorization   | only for Player owner |

post.summary: Create a player for logged-in user
post.description:
Create a new Player. This is not recommended way of creating a new Player and it should be used only in edge cases. The recommended way is to create it via /profile POST endpoint.

Player is representing an object, which holds data related to game player. This object can be used inside the game for example while joining a Clan. Notice, that the Profile object should not be used inside the game (except for logging-in). 

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | Player can be associated with only one Profile |

get.description:
Read Player data by its _id field

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | no |
| Authorization   | no |
| Search | no | 
| Sort | no |
| Pagination | no |

delete.description:
Delete Player by its _id field. Notice that only Player, which belongs to loggen-in user Profile can be deleted. In case when the Player is the only admin in some Clan and the Clan has some other Players, the Player can not be removed. User should be asked to first determine at least one admin for the Clan.

Also, it is not recommended to delete the Player since it can itroduce unexpected behaviour for the user with Profile, but without Player. The better way to remove the Player is do it via /profile DELETE.

Player removal basically means removing all data, which is related to the Player: CustomCharacters, Clan, except for the Profile data. In the case when the Profile does not has a Player, user can only login to the system, but can not play the game.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | only for Player owner |

get.description:
Read Clan data by its _id field

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | no |
| Authorization   | no |
| Search | no | 
| Sort | no |
| Pagination | no |

delete.description:
Delete Clan its _id field. 

Notice that only Clan admins can delete the Clan.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | only for Clan admins |

post.description:
Request to join a Clan. 

Notice that if the Clan is open the Player will be joined automatically without admin approval. 

Notice that if the Player was in another Clan then he/she will be removed from the old one and if in this Clan was no other Players, it will be removed.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | no, but for closed Clans there should be an admin approval first |

Request to leave a Clan. 

Notice that Player can leave any Clan without admin approval.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | no |

get.description:
Read all created Stocks of all Clans. Remember about the pagination

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | no |
| Authorization   | no |
| Search | yes | 
| Sort | yes |
| Pagination | yes | 

## Endpoint description

### General description

Stock is a public place of a Clan, where Items can be stored. These Items, however, can not be stolen from the Clan by other Clans' members during raid. 

### Relations

Stock can belong to one Clan and Clan may have only one Stock. Stock may have many Items. Stock may belong to one Stock.

### CRUD operations

Since a Clan can have only one Stock, the Stock is created automatically whenever a Clan is created.

Stock data can be read by anybody without authentication, as well all existing Stocks list can be fetched.

Stock does not have any data, which can be updated by Clan members. The only field, which can be updated is a cellCount, which hold information about Stock capacity. The starting value of it is 30, but more cells can be bought from store later. The cellCount does not have a limit.

Stock is deleted automatically (and Items related to it) when the Clan to which it belongs to is also deleted.

Read Stock data by its _id field.

Notice that everybody is able to read any Stock data.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | no |
| Authorization   | no |

## Endpoint description

### General description

Stock is a public place of a Clan, where Items can be stored. These Items, however, can not be stolen from the Clan by other Clans' members during raid. 

### Relations

Stock can belong to one Clan and Clan may have only one Stock. Stock may have many Items. Stock may belong to one Stock.

### CRUD operations

Since a Clan can have only one Stock, the Stock is created automatically whenever a Clan is created.

Stock data can be read by anybody without authentication, as well all existing Stocks list can be fetched.

Stock does not have any data, which can be updated by Clan members. The only field, which can be updated is a cellCount, which hold information about Stock capacity. The starting value of it is 30, but more cells can be bought from store later. The cellCount does not have a limit.

Stock is deleted automatically (and Items related to it) when the Clan to which it belongs to is also deleted.

Read Item data by its _id field

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | no |
| Authorization   | no |

-------------

The name field is an enum:

|                |               |                 |              |
|------------------------|-----------------------|--------------------------|-----------------------|
| 'Sofa_Taakka'          | 'Mirror_Taakka'       | 'Floorlamp_Taakka'        | 'Toilet_Schrodinger'  |
| 'Sink_Schrodinger'     | 'Closet_Taakka'       | 'SofaTable_Taakka'        | 'SideTable_Taakka'    |
| 'Carpet_Schrodinger'   | 'Carpet_Rakkaus'      | 'Mirror_Schrodinger'      | 'Mirror_Rakkaus'      |
| 'ArmChair_Taakka'      | 'Sofa_Rakkaus'        | 'ArmChair_Rakkaus'        | 'Closet_Rakkaus'      |
| 'Chair_Neuro'          | 'Dresser_Neuro'       | 'Stool_Neuro'             |                       |

-------------

The recycling field is an enum:

|               |              |    |           |
|-----------------------|-----------------------|------------|-------------------|
| 'Mixed_waste'         | 'Electrical_Equipment'| 'Wood'     | 'Glass'           |
| 'Metal'               | 'Landfill'            |            |                   |

-------------

The qualityLevel field is an enum:

|    |   |    |    |
|------------|------------|------------|------------|
| 'common'   | 'rare'     | 'epic'     |            |

-------------

## Endpoint description

### General description

Items are objects, which can be placed in SoulHomes' Rooms, Stocks and Shop. Item is an object, which has its value in the game and can be bought from the Shop, stolen from the Stock or placed in safe to SoulHome's Room.

Items can be obtained only from Shop and then stored in Room or a Stock.

Item can be a furniture or some other kind of object. The difference between furniture and not furniture is that a furniture can be placed only on a floor. Not furniture can be placed anywhere including on top of a furniture, walls, celling and floor. This data is used in game logic only and does not affect the API in any way.

### Relations

Item can belong to one Room. Room can have multiple Items.

Item can belong to one Stock. Stock can have multiple Items.

Item can belong to Shop. Shop can have multiple Items.

### CRUD operations

Item can not be created by Player. It can only be bought from Shop. API creates new Items automatically.

Item can be read by anyone. One Item can be accessed via its _id field. Multiple Items can be accessed by requesting them within another endpoints via "with" or "all" queries (/stock/:stock_id?with=Item), since they are mostly required together with Stock, Room or Shop data.

Item can not be directly updated by Players. However, Players may move Items from one place to another. They first can buy an Item from Shop and so update Item's place by moving it to the Clan's Stock. Then they can move it from SoulHome to Stock or vice versa. Item can be bought from Shop via /stock/buy enpoint (not yet implemented). Item can be moved from Room to Stock or from Stock to Room via /item/move POST endpoint.

Item can not be deleted.

## Method description

Get SoulHome data for the logged-in user. 

If the logged-in user is a Clan member, the SoulHome for this Clan will be returned. 

If the logged-in user is not belonging to any Clan the 404 error will be returned.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | no |


## Endpoint description

### General description

Soulhome is a safe place for storing Clan Items (inside SoulHome's Rooms). However, it is possible to steal Items from the SoulHome rooms, but the access to CRUD operations mostly lies in hands of Clan members.

SoulHome does have only one field "name", which is same as a Clan name.

### Relations

SoulHome can belong to one Clan and Clan may have only one SoulHome. SoulHome may have many Rooms. Room may belong to one SoulHome.

### CRUD operations

SoulHome must be created automatically when Clan is created. When SoulHome is created 30 Rooms for that SoulHome with default values must created.

## Method description

Get all Rooms for the logged-in user. 

If the logged-in user is a Clan member, the Rooms for this Clan will be returned. 

If the logged-in user is not belonging to any Clan the 404 error will be returned.

If the pagination is required, it can be used, but by  default it will return all 30 rooms at once.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | no |
| Pagination   | yes |
| Sort   | yes |
| Search   | yes |


## Endpoint description

### General description

Room is a place, which can safely store Items of a Clan. However, Items from the Room can be stolen. 

Room is closely related to its SoulHome. SoulHome consists of Rooms. 

Room has an automatic behavior. Room has two statuses active and deactivated. When the Room is becoming deactivated its isActive field is taking on the value false. This should be done automatically when the deactivationTimestamp field is expired.

### Relations

Room can belong to one SoulHome. SoulHome may have many Rooms.

Room can have many Items. Item may belong to one Room.

### CRUD operations

Rooms for a SoulHome must be created automatically, when a SoulHome is created. Therefore there is no enpoint for Room creation.

Room and all Rooms can be read by Clan members, to which the Room (its SoulHome) is belonging.

Room can be updated by Clan members, to which it (its SoulHome) belongs.

Room can be deleted only automatically, when the SoulHome, to which the Room belongs is deleted.

put.description:
## Method description

Update Room by its _id specified in the body.

Any Clan member can update any Room, which (SoulHome) belongs to the Clan.

If the logged-in user is a Clan member and the Clan does have the requested Room, the Room for this Clan will be returned. 

If the logged-in user is not belonging to any Clan, or Room in that Clan with provided _id is not found the 404 error will be returned.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | no |


## Endpoint description

### General description

Room is a place, which can safely store Items of a Clan. Items from the Room can not be stolen. 

Room is closely related to its SoulHome. SoulHome consists of Rooms. 

Room has an automatic behavior. Room has two statuses active and deactivated. When the Room is becoming deactivated its isActive field is taking on the value false. This should be done automatically when the deactivationTimestamp field is expired.

### Relations

Room can belong to one SoulHome. SoulHome may have many Rooms.

Room can have many Items. Item may belong to one Room.

### CRUD operations

Rooms for a SoulHome must be created automatically, when a SoulHome is created. Therefore there is no enpoint for Room creation.

Room and all Rooms can be read by Clan members, to which the Room (its SoulHome) is belonging.

Room can be updated by Clan members, to which it (its SoulHome) belongs.

Room can be deleted only automatically, when the SoulHome, to which the Room belongs is deleted.

| Authorization   | no |
| Search | yes | 
| Sort | yes |
| Pagination | yes | 

The name field is an enum:

|                |               |                 |              |
|------------------------|-----------------------|--------------------------|-----------------------|
| 'Sofa_Taakka'          | 'Mirror_Taakka'       | 'Floorlamp_Taakka'        | 'Toilet_Schrodinger'  |
| 'Sink_Schrodinger'     | 'Closet_Taakka'       | 'SofaTable_Taakka'        | 'SideTable_Taakka'    |
| 'Carpet_Schrodinger'   | 'Carpet_Rakkaus'      | 'Mirror_Schrodinger'      | 'Mirror_Rakkaus'      |
| 'ArmChair_Taakka'      | 'Sofa_Rakkaus'        | 'ArmChair_Rakkaus'        | 'Closet_Rakkaus'      |
| 'Chair_Neuro'          | 'Dresser_Neuro'       | 'Stool_Neuro'             |                       |

-------------

The recycling field is an enum:

|               |              |    |           |
|-----------------------|-----------------------|------------|-------------------|
| 'Mixed_waste'         | 'Electrical_Equipment'| 'Wood'     | 'Glass'           |
| 'Metal'               | 'Landfill'            |            |                   |

-------------

The qualityLevel field is an enum:

|    |   |    |    |
|------------|------------|------------|------------|
| 'common'   | 'rare'     | 'epic'     |            |

-------------

## Endpoint description

### General description

The FleaMarket is the place where the Clans can sell their own Items and other Clans can buy these Items. Items can be purchased by any Clan member using this Clan coins.


### Logic

The FleeMarket contains FleeMarketItems. FleeMarketItem object has a status field which determines what can be done with it:

- Available - Item can be purchased
- Shipping - Item is being shipped = selling Clan members is voting if the Item should be sold or not
- Booking - Item is booked = buying Clan is voting if the Item should be bought or not. Item can be booked for max. 10 min


### Relations

The FleaMarketItem belongs to a selling Clan. The selling Clan can have many FleaMarketItems. FleaMarketItem can belong to one Clan only.


### CRUD operations

FleaMarketItem is added by Clan member by moving the Item from Stock to FleaMarket, which means the Item from Stock is copied to the FleaMarketItem collection and then removed from the Stock.

FleaMarketItems can be read by any logged-in user.

FleaMarketItem data can not be changed at the time and it is read-only.

FleaMarketItem can not be removed from the FleaMarket at the time once it is put there.

## Endpoint description

### General description

### Logic

The FleeMarket contains FleeMarketItems. FleeMarketItem object has a status field which determines what can be done with it:

- Booking - Item is booked = buying Clan is voting if the Item should be bought or not. Item can be booked for max. 10 min


### Relations

### CRUD operations

FleaMarketItem is added by Clan member by moving the Item from Stock to FleaMarket, which means the Item from Stock is copied to the FleaMarketItem collection and then removed from the Stock.

FleaMarketItems can be read by any logged-in user.

Read all created Chats. Remember about the pagination.

Notice, that use of messages array is not advised and can be removed at some point in the future. For accessing messages of the Chat please use the /chat/:_id/message endpoint.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | only for Players above 13 or with parents approval |
| Search | yes | 
| Sort | yes |
| Pagination | yes |

put.description:
Update the Chat, which _id is specified in the body.

Notice that currently anybody is able to change any Chat.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has | 
| -------- | -------- | 
| Authentication | yes | 
| Authorization   | only for Players above 13 or with parents approval |

post.description:
Create a new Chat. The Chat is an object containing messages.

Notice, that currently there is no restrictions on who can create a Chat.

Notice that the Message objects are inner objects of Chat and can not be used enewhere else than in the Chat. There is also no separate collection for the Message in the DB.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has | 
| -------- | -------- | 
| Authentication | yes | 
| Authorization   | only for Players above 13 or with parents approval |

get.description:
TEMPORARY DISABLED AND RETURNS 501

Read Chat data by its _id field

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | only for Players above 13 or with parents approval |
| Search | no | 
| Sort | no |
| Pagination | no |

delete.description:
TEMPORARY DISABLED AND RETURNS 501

Delete Chat by its _id field. 

Notice that currently anybody can delete any Chat.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | only for Players above 13 or with parents approval |

get.summary: Read all messages from the Chat
get.description:
Read all messages of specified Chat. Remember about the pagination

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | only for Players above 13 or with parents approval |
| Search | yes | 
| Sort | yes |
| Pagination | yes |

post.description:
Create a new Message. Message represent the object of message sent by a Player.

Notice that currently there are no authorization required.

Notice, that the messages does not have an usual _id field generated by data base. Instead the Photon id should be used.

Notice that the messages is contained in the array of a Chat collection.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has | 
| -------- | -------- | 
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | only for Players above 13 or with parents approval |

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: Chat _id, with which the message is associated

put.description:
Update the CustomCharacter, which _id is specified in the body.

Only the Player, that owns the CustomCharacter can change it. In case the Player does not own the CustomCharacter the 404 is returned.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has | 
| -------- | -------- | 
| Authentication | yes | 
| Authorization   | only for character owner |

post.description:
Create a new CustomCharacter. CustomCharacter represents a character of the Player. Player can have many CustomCharacters, CustomCharacter can belong to only one Player.

Notice that the player:id field will be determined based on the logged-in player.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has | 
| -------- | -------- | 
| Authentication | yes | 
| Authorization   | only own |

get.description:
Read CustomCharacter data by its _id field.

Notice that if the CustomCharacter does not belong to the logged-in Player 404 should be returned. 

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | only own |
| Search | no | 
| Sort | no |
| Pagination | no |

## Method description

Get Room by its _id. 

If the logged-in user is a Clan member and the Clan does have the requested Room, the Room for this Clan will be returned. 

If the logged-in user is not belonging to any Clan, or Room in that Clan with provided _id is not found the 404 error will be returned.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | no |


## Endpoint description

### General description

Room is a place, which can safely store Items of a Clan. However, Items from the Room can be stolen.

Room is closely related to its SoulHome. SoulHome consists of Rooms. 

Room has an automatic behavior. Room has two statuses active and deactivated. When the Room is becoming deactivated its isActive field is taking on the value false. This should be done automatically when the deactivationTimestamp field is expired.

### Relations

Room can belong to one SoulHome. SoulHome may have many Rooms.

Room can have many Items. Item may belong to one Room.

### CRUD operations

Rooms for a SoulHome must be created automatically, when a SoulHome is created. Therefore there is no enpoint for Room creation.

Room and all Rooms can be read by Clan members, to which the Room (its SoulHome) is belonging.

Room can be updated by Clan members, to which it (its SoulHome) belongs.

Room can be deleted only automatically, when the SoulHome, to which the Room belongs is deleted.

durationS.description: Optional duration of room to be active in seconds

post.description:
## Method description

Activate the specified Rooms.

If Room _id specified in the room_ids field does not belong to logged-in user's Clan (SoulHome), it will be ignored. However it will return 404 if non of the Room _ids does not belong to the Clan. 


## Endpoint description

### General description

Room is a place, which can safely store Items of a Clan. However, Items from the Room can be stolen.  

Room is closely related to its SoulHome. SoulHome consists of Rooms. 

Room has an automatic behavior. Room has two statuses active and deactivated. When the Room is becoming deactivated its isActive field is taking on the value false. This should be done automatically when the deactivationTimestamp field is expired.

### Relations

Room can belong to one SoulHome. SoulHome may have many Rooms.

Room can have many Items. Item may belong to one Room.

### CRUD operations

Rooms for a SoulHome must be created automatically, when a SoulHome is created. Therefore there is no enpoint for Room creation.

Room and all Rooms can be read by Clan members, to which the Room (its SoulHome) is belonging.

Room can be updated by Clan members, to which it (its SoulHome) belongs.

Room can be deleted only automatically, when the SoulHome, to which the Room belongs is deleted.

get.summary: Get SoulHome data from which items can be stolen
get.description:
Based on the provided steal token, which contains the SoulHome _id from which Items can be stolen, the SoulHome data and its Rooms will be returned.

You can see the process flow from [this diagram](https://github.com/Alt-Org/Altzone-Server/tree/dev/doc/img/game_results)

200.description: Array of Items, which were stolen

post.description:
Steal Items from the loser Clan's SoulHome. The stolen Items will be automatically added to a specified Room of the winners Clan's SoulHome.

Notice that at first a steal token should be obtained by the winner player(s) from the /gameData/battle POST endpoint with body type "result", while informing about game result.

Requests without the steal token or with an expired token will get 403 as a response.

Notice that only found SoulHome Items will be stolen. It is possible that some other player already has stoled some of the specified Items, in this case these Items will be ignored since they can not be stolen twice.  

You can see the process flow from [this diagram](https://github.com/Alt-Org/Altzone-Server/tree/dev/doc/img/game_results)

## Endpoint description

### General description

Items are objects, which can be placed in SoulHomes' Rooms, Stocks and Shop. Item is an object, which has its value in the game and can be bought from the Shop, stolen from the Stock or placed in safe to SoulHome's Room.

Items can be obtained only from Shop and then stored in Room or a Stock.

Item can be a furniture or some other kind of object. The difference between furniture and not furniture is that a furniture can be placed only on a floor. Not furniture can be placed anywhere including on top of a furniture, walls, celling and floor. This data is used in game logic only and does not affect the API in any way.

### Relations

Item can belong to one Room. Room can have multiple Items.

Item can belong to one Stock. Stock can have multiple Items.

Item can belong to Shop. Shop can have multiple Items.

### CRUD operations

Item can not be created by Player. It can only be bought from Shop. API creates new Items automatically.

Item can be read by anyone. One Item can be accessed via its _id field. Multiple Items can be accessed by requesting them within another endpoints via "with" or "all" queries (/stock/:stock_id?with=Item), since they are mostly required together with Stock, Room or Shop data.

Item can not be directly updated by Players. However, Players may move Items from one place to another. They first can buy an Item from Shop and so update Item's place by moving it to the Clan's Stock. Then they can move it from SoulHome to Stock or vice versa. Item can be bought from Shop via /stock/buy enpoint (not yet implemented). Item can be moved from Room to Stock or from Stock to Room via /item/move POST endpoint.

Item can not be deleted.

Enpoint for notifying the API about battle events or any other data.

Notice, that the field type is required and determines the type of the data.

Notice that the type also determines shape of the body. Examples, for each type can be found in request examples section.

## Type field

### result

Result of the battle, all players of the battle should send this data.

Notice that team1 and team2 should hold game's player's _id fields.

As a response for winners an access token will be returned, which can be used when stealing Items from losed Clan's SoulHome. Notice that the steal token will expire after some period of time. Losers will get 403 error = they can not get the steal token.

The steal token can be used only by the winner's Clan's members for the loser's Clan Stock.

You can see the process flow from [this diagram](https://github.com/Alt-Org/Altzone-Server/tree/dev/doc/img/game_results)

Move Item from Stock to Room or from Room to Stock, based on the _moveTo_ field, which can have only two values: "Stock" or "Room"

Notice that Clan members can move only own Clan Items and a member is trying to move other Clan's Item the 404 will be returned.

Notice that if an Item need to be moved to a Stock then there is no need to specify the destination_id field, since Clan can have only one Stock.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | no |

## Endpoint description

### General description

Items are objects, which can be placed in SoulHomes' Rooms, Stocks and Shop. Item is an object, which has its value in the game and can be bought from the Shop, stolen from the Stock or placed in safe to SoulHome's Room.

Items can be obtained only from Shop and then stored in Room or a Stock.

Item can be a furniture or some other kind of object. The difference between furniture and not furniture is that a furniture can be placed only on a floor. Not furniture can be placed anywhere including on top of a furniture, walls, celling and floor. This data is used in game logic only and does not affect the API in any way.

### Relations

Item can belong to one Room. Room can have multiple Items.

Item can belong to one Stock. Stock can have multiple Items.

Item can belong to Shop. Shop can have multiple Items.

### CRUD operations

Item can not be created by Player. It can only be bought from Shop. API creates new Items automatically.

Item can be read by anyone. One Item can be accessed via its _id field. Multiple Items can be accessed by requesting them within another endpoints via "with" or "all" queries (/stock/:stock_id?with=Item), since they are mostly required together with Stock, Room or Shop data.

Item can not be directly updated by Players. However, Players may move Items from one place to another. They first can buy an Item from Shop and so update Item's place by moving it to the Clan's Stock. Then they can move it from SoulHome to Stock or vice versa. Item can be bought from Shop via /stock/buy enpoint (not yet implemented). Item can be moved from Room to Stock or from Stock to Room via /item/move POST endpoint.

Item can not be deleted.

post.summary: Buy an Item from the flea market
post.description:
Buy an Item from the flea market. This will start a voting in the Clan for which Item is being purchased. Voting duration is 10 min at max and the min approval percentage is 51. During the voting an Item is in "Booked" status and can not be bought by other players.

Notice that if a FleaMarketItem has already "Booked" status 403 will be returned.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | yes, only buying Clan members |


## Endpoint description

### General description

The FleaMarket is the place where the Clans can sell their own Items and other Clans can buy these Items. Items can be purchased by any Clan member using this Clan coins.


### Logic

The FleeMarket contains FleeMarketItems. FleeMarketItem object has a status field which determines what can be done with it:

- Available - Item can be purchased
- Shipping - Item is being shipped = selling Clan members is voting if the Item should be sold or not
- Booking - Item is booked = buying Clan is voting if the Item should be bought or not. Item can be booked for max. 10 min


### Relations

The FleaMarketItem belongs to a selling Clan. The selling Clan can have many FleaMarketItems. FleaMarketItem can belong to one Clan only.


### CRUD operations

FleaMarketItem is added by Clan member by moving the Item from Stock to FleaMarket, which means the Item from Stock is copied to the FleaMarketItem collection and then removed from the Stock.

FleaMarketItems can be read by any logged-in user.

FleaMarketItem data can not be changed at the time and it is read-only.

FleaMarketItem can not be removed from the FleaMarket at the time once it is put there.

201.description: Successful login with the profile data

post.description:
After the profile with player was created, the user can log in to the system and get a JWT token to access resources.

If the user provides the correct credentials, the access token will be returned, which should be used as a Bearer token in the Authorization header.

If the user provides wrong credentials, a 401 status will be returned.

Request exclude the player from clan. 

Notice that only Clan admin can remove the Player

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | yes, only clan admin |

requestBody.description: File that needs to be uploaded

parameters.name: Battle-Id
parameters.description: Id of the battle to which log file belongs to

post.summary: Upload a game analytics log file
post.description:
Enpoint uploads a log file and save on the server.

The file will be saved to the folder with name corresponding to the date when it was uploaded, i.e. 1-9-2024.

File name must be unique and therefore its name will contain date, time, Player _id and a random string, i.e. 1-9-2024_14-45-12_667eedc9b3b5bf0f7a840ef1_123456.log

Notice that the request must have a Secret header which holds a password for such requests.

Notice that if the Battle-Id header is not defined the current timestamp will be used instead.

Notice that the request must be in multipart/form-data format, where field name containing the file is "logFile"

post.summary: Sell an Item on the flea market
post.description:
Sell an Item on the flea market. This will start a voting in the Clan from which Item is being moved to the flee marked. Voting min approval percentage is 51. During the voting an Item is in "Shipping" status and can not be bought by other players.

Notice that if a FleaMarketItem has already "Shipping" status 403 will be returned.

| Feature / Requirement | Is / Has |
| -------- | -------- |
| Authentication | yes |
| Authorization   | yes, only selling Clan members |

## Endpoint description

### General description

The FleaMarket is the place where the Clans can sell their own Items and other Clans can buy these Items. Items can be purchased by any Clan member using this Clan coins.


### Logic

The FleeMarket contains FleeMarketItems. FleeMarketItem object has a status field which determines what can be done with it:

- Available - Item can be purchased
- Shipping - Item is being shipped = selling Clan members is voting if the Item should be sold or not
- Booking - Item is booked = buying Clan is voting if the Item should be bought or not. Item can be booked for max. 10 min


### Relations

The FleaMarketItem belongs to a selling Clan. The selling Clan can have many FleaMarketItems. FleaMarketItem can belong to one Clan only.


### CRUD operations

FleaMarketItem is added by Clan member by moving the Item from Stock to FleaMarket, which means the Item from Stock is copied to the FleaMarketItem collection and then removed from the Stock.

FleaMarketItems can be read by any logged-in user.

FleaMarketItem data can not be changed at the time and it is read-only.

FleaMarketItem can not be removed from the FleaMarket at the time once it is put there.

get.description: Get all active votings of the logged user clan.

put.description:
Send a vote.

The minimum acceptance percentage refering to the min percentage of a group members that need to accept some option for the voting to be concluded. For example Clan members are voting whenever they want to sell an Item or not and the min percentage might be 51 => if 51% of all this Clan members accept to sell the Item then the Item can be sold and otherwise if the 51% of Clan members reject to sell the Item it will not be sold. Same logic can be applied if there are more than 2 options available.

Voting endpoint is served for different kinds of votings. The "type" field is an enum and determines what value the "choice" field may have.

| type          | options            |
| ------------- | ------------------ |
| selling_item: | "accept", "reject" |
| buying_item:  | "accept", "reject" |


## selling_item

Player votes whenever he/she wants that an item is going for sale to the flea market. The voter must be a member of the Clan from which item is going to sale, otherwise 403 will be returned. The min acceptance percentage is 51%. Notice that during the voting process there will be sent different notifications via MQTT:
- new voting started
- somebody has voted
- voting ended

## buying_item

Player votes whenever he/she wants that an item should be bought from the flea market or not. The voter must be a member of the Clan for which item is going to be bought, otherwise 403 will be returned. The min acceptance percentage is 51%. The time limit for the voting is 10 mins. Notice that during the voting process there will be sent different notifications via MQTT:
- new voting started
- somebody has voted
- voting ended
- error if time limit expired

get.description:
Get data of the current voting state.

Notice that it can return 403 in case the logged-in player does not have permission to access the voting, for example if the player tries to access a voting that is an internal for other Clan.

Returns a list of logged-in Player's tasks. 

The period query works as follows:

today - all tasks for today (completed and uncomleted)

week - all tasks for the current week (completed and uncomleted) including daily tasks.

month - all tasks for the current month (completed and uncompleted), including weekly and daily tasks.

You can find the a json file of player tasks [here](https://github.com/Alt-Org/Altzone-Server/blob/dev/src/playerTasks/playerTasks.json)

| Feature         | Has                     |
| --------------- | ----------------------- |
| Authentication  | yes                     |
| Authorization   | only Player's own tasks |
| Search          | yes                     | 
| Sort            | yes                     |
| Pagination      | yes                     | 

## General description

The daily task is a predefined task for an individual player to perform.

There are tasks for each day, each two weeks and each month.

Player is getting points for each completed task and each task brings different amount of points and coins.

These points and coins are going to the player's clan. The points are used to determine top clans in the game and the coins are used to purchase items from the flee market of the game.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Period of time for the tasks

get.description:
Leaderboard of players. Top Players are defined by the amount of points that he/she has.

Notice that the leaderboards data is updated once every 12 hours.

Leaderboard of clans. Top Clans are defined by the amount of points that each Clan has.

Notice that the leaderboards data is updated once every 12 hours.

get.summary: Get basic info about logged-in user
get.description:
Get basic info of the logged-in user:

- Profile
- Player
- Clan

get.summary: logged-in user's clan on the leaderboard
get.description:
Get the logged-in user's clan position on the leaderboard.

Note that if the logged-in user is not in any clan the 404 will be returned

200.description: Found items of the clan into two separate arrays for stock and soulhome.

get.summary: Get items of the logged-in user clan
get.description:
Get items of the logged-in user clan.

Notice that it will return 403 if the logged-in player is not in any clan.
Get logged-in player chosen CustomCharacters for a battle
Get specific daily task by _id

delete.description:
Delete task by specified _id.

Notice that a new task will be generated to replace the old one.

put.description:
Reserve a daily task for the loged-in player.

Reserved task can not be taken by other clan members.

Notice that clan members will get a notification about the task was reserved

post.description:
Create a testing box.

Notice that in order t ocreate the testing box a group admin password need to be obtained from backend team

delete.description:
Delete box data associated with the logged-in user.

Notice that the box can be removed only by the box admin.

get.description:
Tester can claim his/her account for the testing box.

Notice that the tester should know the shared testers password in order to be able to clain the account. This password is available after the group admin has started the session.

Notice that the endpoint should be called only from browser, since a cookie should be added by the API

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Testers shared password, which can be obtained from group admin after testing session starts

get.description: Temporary endpoint for development stage, which lets get any box data by its _id

delete.description:
Delete a box by its _id.

Notice that it is a temporary endpoint for the development stage

put.description:
Update a predefined daily task of a box by its _id.

Notice that only group admin can update the tasks

post.summary: Add a daily task to box
post.description:
Add a daily task to array of predefined daily tasks.

Notice that the logged-in player has to be a group admin

Add multiple daily tasks at once to daily tasks array of the box.

Notice that only group admin can add the tasks.

delete.description:
Delete daily task from predefined daily tasks array of the box.

Notice that only group admin can delete the tasks

put.description:
Reset testing box data, which means removing all the data created during the testing session and returning the box state to the PREPARING stage. For more information refer to the testing box documentation.

Notice that only box admin can do the action.

post.description: Endpoint for adjusting amount of testers in the box. Notice that only box admin can do it

200.description:
Found object(s). The response objects has three fields: data, metaData and paginationData.
The data has the requested data. It has an object or array, which key is a collection name.

The metaData contains additional data, which can be used for parsing the data object: 
dataKey - collection name, in data object,
dataType - type of object in data object.

The paginationData is the data for pagination. Only on GET requests, when reading many objects

modelName.description: model name, usually same as dataKey

dataCount.description: 1 for Object dataType and length if Array

limit.description: The limit of items per page

201.description:
Created object. The response objects has two fields: data, metaData.

The data has the created object data. It has an object inside, which key is a collection name.

The metaData contains additional data, which can be used for parsing the data object: 
dataKey - collection name, in data object,
dataType - type of object in the data object.

username.description: The username for the Profile, unique

backpackCapacity.description: The capacity of the player’s backpack

uniqueIdentifier.description: A unique identifier for the player

above13.description: Indicates if the player is above 13 years old

parentalAuth.description: Indicates if parental authorization is required

battleCharacter_ids.description: An array of up to 3 battle character MongoDB IDs

currentAvatarId.description: The current avatar ID of the player

_id.description: The _id of the clan to be updated

isOpen.description: whenever the clan is open or closed

labels.description: labels that describes the clan, notice that it is an enum

ageRange.description: the age range of the Clan, notice it is an enum

goal.description: the goal of the Clan, notice it is an enum

phrase.description: the motto phrase of the Clan

language.description: the language that Clan primarly uses, notice it is an enum

pieceColors.description: List of piece colors in hexadecimal format.

player_id.description: who want to join the Clan

username.description: The username for the Profile, unique
